bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 27 (Monday, February 10, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. NORTON:H.R. 5834.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following: clause 18 of section 8 of article I of theConstitution.[Page H1017]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E159)

summary.text:
Increased Transparency in 501(c)(4) Organizations Act of 2020

This bill requires tax-exempt organizations to make available for public inspection notifications that must be submitted to the Internal Revenue Service regarding the intent to operate under section 501(c)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code.

bill.title: Increased Transparency in 501(c)(4) Organizations Act of 2020

item.title: Increased Transparency in 501(c)(4) Organizations Act of 2020
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to require the disclosure of notifications of intent to operate under section 501(c)(4).
Increased Transparency in 501(c)(4) Organizations Act of 2020

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
